programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the pretty village of Luxton Deeping, there's fierce conflict between the traditional film and modern digital photographers. When their societies committee decide not to accept digital images at the annual photographic exhibition, it appears to make things worse. It leads to a confrontation at the private view. The following day Lionel Bell is found murdered in woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The inhabitants of Midsomer Magna are in the spotlight, quite literally when a production crew descend on the village and imposing Manor House. To film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. Not only the film crew arrive, but a notorious criminal as well, George Ince, lurking around the Manor. When Nick Cheney, the film's director is found dead, by the use of the prop guillotine. The detectives need to sift through many motives which lead to the complexity.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Holm, a rehabilitation scheme for reformed criminals continues. When Ronnie Tyler departs, he gets a good send off from everyone, including DCI Barnaby. Another attendee is Jack Colby, a disgraced ex-policeman and former colleague of Barnaby. Jack is decidedly frosty towards his once-former friend and refuses to chat. When Jack is later murdered, Barnaby must search for answers in Jack's past for motives.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valleys comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former model.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friends wedding.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Deep in Blacktrees Forest is a bombproof shelter, at which a doomsday prepper group meets weekly.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is called in when a new arrival to a tight-knit community for retired police officers is found dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A trendy organic bakery in a restored mill is at the centre of a local dispute which leads to a death.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A Parish chairwoman is found dead in a local theatre, possibly because of her hostility toward a drag show.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The villagers of Fletcher's Cross are preparing for their team match against Midsomer Worthy. Tara Cavendish, the second wife of local landowner and cricket captain Robert Cavendish, has since gone missing after taking their dog for a walk. When her body is later discovered nearby in a disused quarry, with the weapon, a cricket bat lying, next to her.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Alice Bly arrives at Lawnside, a nursing home in Aspern Tallow to rest after having hospital treatment. She soon suspects something is not right when a fellow resident dies the night after her arrival. It is also discovered that the lady's valuable Cartier watch has also gone missing. Alice's nephew DCI Barnaby agrees to look into things despite having a week's leave. It is not long before two more deaths quickly follow the first and a mysterious visitor is seen lurking around at night.
